Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and fulfills expectations”
Reviews.Author: SuTengKai
Reviews.Content: For the last 3 years I have spent one week at HCC Open while attend the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona. The hotel is both 5 star and 3 star. It is 3 star in terms of appearance, fit out, amenities, etc., but it is 5 star in that it fulfills exactly what I want for that week, namely proximity to the Congress, well functioning wireless, and helpful staff. The rooms are a bit worn, check-in is slow, there is nothing fancy about the place. The staff is friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet is good. Other reviews said it is pricey but for me it was bundled into my corporate rate and thus cheaper, same for WIFI. I would not recommend the hotel for families or luxury seeks, but happily recommend it for people wanting a comfortable, easy business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God for Good Shades”
Reviews.Author: clntard
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling non-stop for 13 years and this is one of the few Hotels who had block out shades to keep the light out of the room effectively. Rooms were very clean and in order. Location was perfect for visits to the Fira Montjuic for a trade show. Careful with breakfast at 16 eur a pop, that is a bit excessive for their limited options.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Madi M
Reviews.Content: It's a bit of a hike away from the center of town, but I was truly pleased with this hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are adequately sized and very clean. We happened to be staying across the hall from a loud group for one night, but other than that, I have no complaints. When it comes to budget-friendly hotels, this is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable budget hotel in a so-so neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Vegan35
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel was fine. It has all your basic necessities; it could even be considered "budget business class." The staff is friendly and helpful, and you're within walking distance of the Metro (5 mins) and Plaza Espanya (10 mins). HOWEVER, the area is a little sketchy at night. There's not much to do nearby, a lot of stores are closed and the hotel is off the main street. After taking the Metro back late one night, we decided cabs were a safer bet for the rest of the trip. AND...at about 4 a.m. on Saturday night, someone tried to break into our room!!! I woke up to the door handle being strongly jiggled while someone pushed on the door. Thankfully, they didn't get in but it scared the bejesus out of us and we wound up wedging a chair under the handle the rest of the trip. Other than that, good luck getting an extra towel or pillow (you'll want them). Be persistent! And vigilant! Overall, it's a clean, friendly hotel. But I would not stay here again due to the location and attempted break-in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: grendog2
Reviews.Content: It is tough to find a reasonably priced, well located hotel in Barcelona. This one is very good, between Plaza di Spagna and Plaza Catalunya. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are OK. The breakfast is way overpriced! GoWiFi is only available in the lobby. The TV is horrible. There are plenty of restaurants right on the block. You can also easily walk to plaza di spagna where you will find even more. There is a shopping center there that is built to look like a bull ring. Take the outside elevator that rides up to the top and try the pizzeria up there, or one of the other two restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfils Expectations of 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boydluvsedisto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights in Sept. Benefits of Hotel are the location which is not central but well connected due to the metro just around the corner. Being one street back from the busy and noisy Gran Via means that these rooms are quieter than others in the area. The rooms were clean but simple. No Wifi connection in the rooms but LAN cables available at the reception. Room service was lacking, note to self: next time check for a bath towel before taking a shower. The air conditioning is old meaning it has three levels but no room temperature setting. Use of room safe costs!

Reviews.Title: “great holiday & great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo253
Reviews.Content: my friend and i have just spent 5 fantastic days in barcalona! never been before but will return for sure!!! managed to cram lots of sights into our trip, lots of shoppin and still time for eating, drinking, and sunbathing!! the hotel is ideal for being close by to restaurants, shops and the local bus routes to las rambles but not close enough so you are disturbed by the busy nightlife in the early hours, very clean, staff helpfull and speak english, breakfast suited our needs just fine, would stay again at the hcc open xx

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Malteaser_89
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I spent a fantastic four days in Barcelona. We managed to cram everything we wanted into that time even in the August heat. The hotel was well located to reach all sites. It was 10 minutes walk from the Olympic park, 20 minutes walk from Las Ramblas, and close enough to the Nou Camp. It was clean, the breakfast was adequate (though no hot option) and there was a great restaurant 10m from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Staff pleasant, but located too far out from attractions/centre/beach.”
Reviews.Author: Anon-Stockport
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a residential area, although we felt safe walking around at night it was too far to walk to the centre. Breakfast was €16 (nit including tax pp)! We took others advice & ate breakfast two blocks away on the main road. Hotel was clean, but beds weren't changed every day. There was a hole in the bath that had been plugged with a bit of silicone. The rooms were tired in decoration, but not unusuL for European hotel decor, and you get what you pay for. We stayed in a room classed as on the inside (quieter than on the front if the hotel). Avoid this option if you are a light sleeper or enjoy sleeping at all. It backed into the service lifts & a cupboard for their supplies-v. noisy. T.v. Was circa 1980s equipped with Spanish channels only-great if you want to brush up or learn Spanish. It wasn't so good for us as due to location we could have dine with some English entertainment at night. Hotel has free wi-fi but this is only accessible in the lobby. We took others advice & got the aerobus to & from the airport, saving approx €15 pp.

Reviews.Title: “Ok only if nothing better in price range”
Reviews.Author: EP99
Reviews.Content: The HCC Open Hotel claims to be 3 stars. That is definitely true if each star represents a request for additional pillows, because it took three requests over a two day period to actually get an additional pillow (with the staff saying each time that it would promptly be taken care of). Will you need an additional pillow? Only if you like resting your neck on something that isn't as nearly as flat as the mattress itself. Getting that out of the way, the rooms are solid quality and a pretty nice size, and the location of the hotel isn't bad. It is probably a 15-20 minute walk to the start of the crazy part of La Rambla and there are two metro stops near the hotel (both on the same line unfortunately). The actual neighborhood where the hotel was pretty calm, which I liked, and there are some restaurants and bars nearby, but a lot of the best restaurants and bars in the same neighborhood were a 10-15 minute walk away. The hotel staff, though initially unfriendly, redeemed themselves and ended up being helpful, though don't expect to be greeted warmly like you might at some other hotels in Europe. A map (the least helpful map I've gotten from a hotel in Europe) was only provided after it was requested, and no attempt was made at the time to show the location of the hotel on the map. We had the unfortunate luck to be staying in the hotel at the same time as a large group (25 or 30) of loud, obnoxious men who decided to have parties in their room from basically midnight to 3 a.m. That isn't the hotel's fault. However, what I do fault the hotel for is (1) the thinness of the walls; and (2) the fact that this went on for three nights of our (and presumably other guests' ) complaints Wireless, though free, does not work in the rooms. There is free ethernet in the rooms, but what they don't tell you is that it is barely faster than dial up. We discovered dirty sheets partway through our stay, so either they weren't changing the sheets (more likely) or they were putting dirty looking sheets on the beds. As my title says, this hotel isn't bad if there's nothing better in the price range, which is why I stayed there in the first place. It isn't a horrible hotel, even if I made it sound that way. However, it did not live up to my expectations for a three star hotel, and was much more of a two star hotel in terms of experience.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: NorthernerSunderland
Reviews.Content: This hotel easily reached by the aerobuus from the airport. Take the aerobus from the airport to Urgell bus stop which is the stop after Place de Espanya. Cross over the road and the hotel is located two blocks on the right. This is a good base to explore Barcelona. La Ramblas is approx 15 minute walk. The hotel is clean and the rooms are very spacious. Ask for a room facing the street as the inside rooms are facing a wall with minimal light. The breakfast has a wide range to choose from, which sets you up for the day. An enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarineDav
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and spacious and we had a great stay. The air conditionning was perfect. The location of the hotel is okay since you can walk from it to get to Placa Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore”
Reviews.Author: mfg75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days,hotel is faraway enough from the madness of la rambla but still plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. Hotel and rooms very clean and a good size, hotel staff very pleasant and spoke great English.get off the aero bus at Urgell and hotel is about 5 mins walk. Urgell and Rocafort metro stops are 5 mins walk away from hotel and take you right into catalunya plaza in 5 mins.You can walk it in about 20. Try La courgelet bar facing hotel for great mojitos,food and service(i read about it in a review and its a cosy wee bar).Hotel not plush by no means but if its somewhere to lay the head at night and close enough to city, its more than fine..

Reviews.Title: “excellent base”
Reviews.Author: erk
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel. It is in an excellent, quiet location, near public transportation, not in the middle of the main tourist area. The staff is warm and helpful; the buffet breakfast is varied and good. The rooms are clean and comfortable. There is free ADSLinternet conenction in each room, free WIFI in the lobby. The center of town is a 15 - 20 minute walk. There are good restaurants less than a block away. We returned to Restaurant Mediterrani (Diputacio 73) almost everyday: excellent service, menu in English, reasonable prices, English spoken, and most important superb food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav_01
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with reasonable prices, centrally located (5 mins walk from the palace) Amazing breakfast believe me!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A true value for money”
Reviews.Author: titamou
Reviews.Content: Great services, free parking, free wi-fi, clean, tidy neat rooms, close to Rocafort metro station. Polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kascerri
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel for a week the staff spoke english which was nice as it was difficult to find people who did and very helpful when asked for tips or directions. breakfast was a good variety and everywhere was clean room comfortable even with the added bed and less then ten minutes walk from placa espana and the magic fountains and few minutes for metro which are really easy to use

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Barcelona, HCC Open suited us well”
Reviews.Author: tintinwannabe
Reviews.Content: We booked an inexpensive vacation to Barcelona and the HCC Open was where we stayed. The staff was helpful, location a little far from the main sights. It took 1/2 hour to walk to Las Ramblas, but the metro stop was close by if you wanted to get to city center quicker. We decided to stroll outdoors and enjoy the sunshine. Breakfast at the hotel was included and we found the selection good and the food offered was fresh and abundant. Any questions we had for the front desk were answered by the staff in perfect english (our spanish is limited) the room was kept clean and we didn't have trouble sleeping, we found it quiet. Nice restaurant/bar right across the street "El Cargolet" ate there almost every day. Awesome paella and sangria, pizza, mojitos, tapas etc. The hotel had a good guidebook listing all the HCC hotels in Barcelona and information about each district. Our package deal was so inexpensive that we found the HCC Open suitable for the price and were satisfied with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - Close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: bbono001
Reviews.Content: Close to the metro stop, otherwise its about a 20 minute walk to the University. Nice rooms, friendly staff (this was important because we tried extending our tour and needed their help with printing and timetables etc.). The only thing that was off was, as we checked in, the carpet outside our room in the lobby was covered in bed sheets... I think the maid staff had shampooed the carpet but who knows. Other than that, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Argonarc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at this hotel and there was very little to fault. Very clean, the staff were very polite and friendly. About 15min walk to the start of Las Ramblas. Barcelona is a wonderful friendly city, but with our £ exchange rate there ain't nothing cheap out there. Don't eat out on the Ramblas, unless you have plenty of cash. The city tour bus is good value and you can hop on and off, with another bus arriving every 10min. If you do stay i would recommend a Japanese restaraunt, it's 15euros for a buffet and has chinese food as well as sushi. You can also pick your food and the chef will cook it for you. Turn right out of the hotel onto the boulevard, turn right again and it's a couple of minutes walk. Also as mentioned in a previous post, if you have breakfast there you can ask for bacon and eggs. Also a taxi from Barcelona airport is about 25euro and there were four of us.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel when in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Mercman111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, only five minutes walk from the nearest metro. Good restaurants, and small take aways close by. Room was clean and quiet, staff were helpful. Make sure you ask for the cooked breakfast, it is not always offered!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wildcat00Usa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Rooms were nice and very clean. Hotel staff was nice and courteous. Very helpful. Good breakfast buffet which was included in the cost of the hotel. Hotel gives each guest a coupon for a complimentary glass of champagne upon check in. Very limited menu in the hotel restaurant. Not alot of variety. Not the best location. I would stay in this same hotel but at a different location within Barclona.

Reviews.Title: “STARNGE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Panky1970
Reviews.Content: Our stay was otherwise very cool. One strange thing happened with me. I was having breakfast and suddenly I saw one well dressed smart guy runnning away with my bag. When I ran behind him our tour guide threatened the thief to click his photograph if he does not drop the bag. The guy dropped the bag on the road and ran away. That means security is lacking in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice room!”
Reviews.Author: KRoyal
Reviews.Content: The room was great, big for Europe standards with a nice shower! The only problems we had were minor--the internet would not work and we could never seem to find it when we returned at night (we got lost a lot on the way back from the metro). The staff spoke English very well which was helpful to get our bearings and find information before we headed out into the city (where most do not speak English). They were very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again! The price for a double was similar to a hostel price for two people and the quality was much much better!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype, it's only adequate.”
Reviews.Author: d0zy10
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews here, we were very much looking forward to our trip. I had high hopes for this hotel. My girlfriend and I had a great weekend in Barcelona but that had nothing to do with the hotel. This hotel is perfectly fine. It's clean and comfortable. However, a lot of the reviews imply that there is something special. It's a very standard 3* hotel with no character, that is quite a walk from the old town. Some estimations range at about 15 minutes on this site. You'd be lucky to get to the top of Las Ramblas in 30 minutes and it's another 15 minutes after that down to the marina. There are very few restaurants nearby and everything closes early around the hotel. If I were going back to Barcelona, I would stay elsewhere. There was nothing wrong with this hotel, however, there are plenty of better options in El Barri Gotic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, and not too far from anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Brodiej
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time i've stayed at the Open which says a lot. The location is slightly out of the mix of the main tourist sites being situated near Rockefort metro stop, but you can walk there in 10 minutes or get a tube. Its pretty quiet, the rooms are modern and clean, the staff are friendly and helpful and it didn't cost too much cash either. Only piece of advice is on car parking....the entrance is so hard to see and you need to have checked in before you can get in, so have a plan of where to park up to check-in beforehand. If you've got a car wiith you, the location actually works more.....you can get onto the Grand Via simply by turning right out the car park and going 3-4 blocks down. From there you can get anywhere East or West of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring a great city.”
Reviews.Author: HitchHiker26
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. It's not a great hotel, but it is a good one. When you visit a city like Barcelona, you spend so little time in your hotel that all you really need is a good, clean comfortable place to stay and the HCC Open certainly foots the bill in this regard. Mrs H and I like to walk, and this is a lovely 15 - 20 minute walk to the Placa Catalunya and the start of Las Rambas. If walking doesn't suit, a taxi will cost around 5 Euro or their is a Metro stop nearby which will have you in the midst o the action within 5 minutes at the grand cost on €1.30.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: Pad97
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for anyone wanting to stay close to the centre but in a local area which is non touristy and friendly. There were lots of good local restaurants and bars which were very reasonably priced . Staff on the reception were very welcoming and did all that could to assist us with our stay. The rooms were spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We would definetly return. Our only problem was on the metro . As a group of women we were targetted twice by girl gangs of pickpockets. Watch out for women working in threes blocking your way when you get on the train and trying to open your handbag as you try and move out of the way. Gangs also came up behind us and attempted to cut the strap of a handbag ! We were fortunate not to have anything stolen but it was'nt good to feel that we had to be on guard all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to disappoint”
Reviews.Author: CazGor
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed in this hotel and it never fails to disappoint. It may not be in the centre of Barcelona but it is a 10-15 minute walk away from the centre. There is also 2 metro stops about 2 minutes walk from the hotel, thus making the hotel very accessible to see all of Barcelona. Would strongly recommend the metro to anyone. Trains run regularly and get you anywhere in the city much quicker than the sight seeing buses do. If using the metro there are automated ticket machines at all the stations. Would recommend that you buy a ticket for 10 journeys as it is better value for money than single trip tickets. You will be surprised how much you will hop on and off the metro. Check in was as straightforward as ever. All staff are very helpful and polite. Rooms are quite spacious for some European city hotels and are maintained to a high standard and cleaned on a daily basis. The rooms are lacking tea and coffee making facilities but with cafes and eateries near by you do not really miss this. The hotel also does not have a restaurant but there are that many eateries in Barcelona that this is not a problem. If eating out I would recommend that you eat away from las ramblas as this is much cheaper. There are many good places but my personal recommendation would be to eat at the maremagnum. There is an exceptional italian restaurant called Gino's. I have never been able to fault the quality of their food or the service. There is also a good all you can eat buffet at the maremagnum also. For those looking to relax, I would recommend a trip to the beach at barceloneta. If you want to go to some of the main attractions such as Gaudi's house I recommend you get there early as queues can be long. Another tip would be if you want to go to see the fountains in the evening I recommend you are there for about 9pm as this seems to be when the main show starts. All in all Barcelona is a city that never disappoints and neither does this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accomodation for a mini-break”
Reviews.Author: jaxxy123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break, staying at this hotel. We being 1 adult and a teenager. The hotel staff are friendly and accomodating, the rooms were comfortable and very clean and the location is perfect for touring the city. We became very familiar with the workings of the Metro and this hotel is in a location that is accessible to all of the major sights, whether you want to walk or ride. Booked room only, and never realised how much I would miss the 'luxury' of tea and coffe making facilites in the room. After a long day out, the restaurant was closed and the room service menu very limited. The nearest cafes have not quite caught up with the 'Starbucks' take-away culture so be prepared to navigate your way back to your room trying not to spill a very hot coffee from an ordinary plastic cup! Breakfast in the hotel is expensive at 15 euros if not included in your booking and whilst offering quite a selection is only average. Satellite tv is provided but the only english speaking channels for those of us who can't be bothered to be bi-lingual is CNN and Eurosport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - need to taxi to centre though”
Reviews.Author: Gemma1977
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Barcelona in the middle of a fiesta, this was the only hotel tourist information could offer us. It was a good standard with helpful staff, but a long walk from La Ramblas and waterfront. Parking was under the hotel, breakfasts were buffet style and OK.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fit for the purpose”
Reviews.Author: jimmylonghurst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend and would recommend it to anyone. It is a clean and modern hotel with helpful staff and reasonably priced (E110), there is a metro stop about a two minute walk away and the Rambla is about a 15 walk away. We didnt use the bar as it looked a bit soulless but there were enough in the neighbourhood for it not to make a difference. The magic fountain at Placa Espanya is a 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Jayaw
Reviews.Content: Maybe we were unlucky, but our experience of this hotel wasn't great. On check-in, the girl was indifferent and took literally 10 mins to check us in. She kept answering the phone instead of checking us in. The room was fine, except the bath and shower tap didn't work- you had to run a bath at the same time as having a shower! We left a fault card filled in, but nothing happened. The breakfast is served from 7-11am, which is good, but it was no better than basic. The croissants weren't fresh and the toaster took forever. It did amuse us watching people wait for toast though! One guest asked for soft boiled eggs, which should have been available according to the menu- but the grumpy waitress clearly couldn't be bothered and just said no! The location is good- about 5 mins from the metro- just two stops and a few mins to Las Ramblas. Or you can walk it in about 20mins. In summary- the Open Hotel is ok, but that is about it, we've stayed in nicer hotels for a similar price. I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: freddiesno1
Reviews.Content: Clean, tidy, quiet hotel with helpful staff. Our triple room was spacious, clean and quiet. Breakfast is served until 11am which is very handy if you have a few late nights! The location is good, just a few minutes walk from metro red line, 5 minutes by taxi or 20-30 minutes walk to town (Ramblas, gothic quarter, loads of shops, bars and restaurants). No hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “City Break Stay”
Reviews.Author: WAYLEAF
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my husbands 50th birthday in this fabulous city! The hotel lived up to its expectations - the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the linen immaculate. The air conditioning was efficient and the breakfast was excellent. We requested extra pillows and within 5 minutes our request was granted. The only down side was the distance from the Ramblas - it was a fairly long walk but taxis are fairly reasonable. However, Barcelona FC was only a very short distance and was the highlight of our stay!!!! We picked the weekend of the festival of St John (we didn't know at the time of the booking) and the fireworks continued until about 5 am!! We would definitely recommend this friendly hotel to anyone wanting a long weekend in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to discover Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ajinternational
Reviews.Content: First visit to Barcelona and this hotel suited our needs perfectly. Chose to stay here since feedback from friends and family was that the city centre tourist areas (Las Ramblas etc) would be loud well into the wee small hours. Getting to and from hotel was simple – we took airport bus (Aerobus) to Plaza Espana – hotel is a 10 minute walk away. Modern hotel, friendly staff, clean spacious rooms – pictures on the internet are exactly what we got (not always the case!). Beds are comfortable, air-con is efficient, rooms are double glazed so you’ll get a good night's sleep! Booked through Lastminute.com Special Offer and paid £294.00 for 4 nights. Emailed request for high floor to the hotel, which they allocated us. Didn’t have breakfast at the hotel – it wasn’t included in our rate and at 14 Euros per person, it seemed a bit expensive for what was on offer; we did, however, get a free glass of Cava (although the bar area where you claim it from is dead!) There’s plenty of small cafés and great cake shops in the vicinity which offer much better value for money. Hotel is about a 10 – 15 minute walk to the University then a further 5 minutes or so to the Plaza Catalunya and the start of the Ramblas. It’s a nice walk along tree lined boulevards with lots of interesting buildings en route. There’s also the Rocafort Metro Station just round the corner for the hotel – the metro system is really simple to use (just make sure you go through the right side of the ticket barrier!) The only 'negative observation' (and not a problem) was the lack of restaurants in the local area - plenty of small bars with tapas etc, but nothing really serving anything more substantial. There's a Mediterranean Restaurant across the road which serves traditional meals - ideal of pig's trotters are your cup of tea... I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: trevostar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new so the facilities are quite complete. Lobby area looks modern and efficient, albeit nothing fancy. The room was decent, although mine in particular had a stuffy smell when I first entered, it probably hadn't been used in a long while. No worries though, open the window and the smell was gone the next morning. At least not every room was like that, as my colleague's room was fine. Free high speed internet in the room, which is GREAT. Have to give kudos for every hotel that provide this service free of charge as it is becoming one of the necessities in our daily life, and so many hotels out there still charge you a rip-off amount for it. Here you just have to borrow their Ethernet cable and you're all set to go. Location is very nice, Barcelona is not that big and you can walk to La Ramblas in about 20 min. Of course you can take the subway too which is near the hotel. Nice shops and restaurants in the nearby area although it is not the commercial touristy zone. Think I prefer this to being right in the centre as this feels more neighbourhoody but still convenient. Overall, a good choice that is reasonably priced. No complaints here. So if you are looking for something non-fancy and no frills but convenient and comfortable then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: swisstravel
Reviews.Content: I really like the location of this hotel - we took the bus from the airport and it stops about 2 blocks from the hotel. Close to the subway and an easy walk to the center (about 10 - 15 min). It is in a very safe neigborhood. Check-in was a bit slow but it was during a busy time and the staff was courteous. Did not try the breakfast as it was too expensive. There is a cafe right across the street, which we went for breakfast. The room size is good, very clean. The best thing about this hotel is that it i right next to a health food store that sells all sorts of gluten free product (important to me since I have celiac disease). There are cafes, convenience stores nearby. Definitely would stay here again if I visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel no problems with the location”
Reviews.Author: sswamy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HCC Open with my parents (senior citizens) and had a great stay. Ten minutes after we arrived at Barcelona Estacion del Norte bus station, my mother's handbag with ALL her documents got stolen (side note: beware of the rampant theft problems in Barcelona and keep your stuff in a money belt or other secure location..). After a long couple of hours spent at the police station and then scouring the station trying to locate the purse possibly discarded after the cash was taken out, the HCC Open was a nice place to come and take a breather. The staff at the front desk (who spoke great English) were pretty helpful with the whole situation. We got a triple room with 2 double beds for a great price. The room was clean and when we had problems with our TV, the staff immediately sent someone up to fix it. The restaurant food is reasonably priced and decent, and there is internet connectivity (though it will cost you 3.50 for 15 minutes). In terms of location, the HCC is a little bit away from Las Ramblas and on a Sunday/late nights there isn't much open near the hotel by way of restaurants or shops. However, the Rocafort metro stop is a stone's throw away from the hotel and you can basically get anywhere more interesting within 5-10 minutes. I've stayed in Las Ramblas during a previous visit to Barcelona and found it to get a bit noisy/rowdy during the weekends and thus decided to try something a little out of the city for my parents to get a good nights' sleep. I think it was a wise decision! All in all, this is a great hotel and unless you're particular about staying in the centre of things, I would recommed it without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lite
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 4 night stay in this modern hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. Although the staff were unable to provide us with the non-smoking room that we had requested in advance, the room provided did not smell. Restaurant - We enjoyed a delicious seafood lunch at Mar de la Ribera - Carrer Sombrerers 7. It is a short metro ride from the hotel to Jaume 1.

Reviews.Title: “An absolulte bargain”
Reviews.Author: Travelling2006
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel two days in advance as we were staying on the coast in Salou and fancied a night in Barcelona. And what a bargain - £52 for an extremely clean, bright, spacious and well ventilated room. The location is good too especially given the price - a stone's throw from the Gran Via and around 20 mins walk from Las Ramblas. It's also right next to a couple of Metro stations if you don't fancy the walk. Don't be put off by the 3 star rating - this is more like a 4 star but without the facilities such as swimming pool etc. Would definitley stay in this hotel again.
